benchmark_details.name: Neuron State-Based Cross-Lingual Alignment (NeuronXA)
benchmark_details.overview: NeuronXA assesses the cross-lingual alignment capabilities of large language models by quantifying neuron activation likelihood in response to parallel corpora across multiple languages.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a robust evaluation framework for assessing the multilingual capabilities of large language models.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The evaluation method requires access to model intrinsic representations, limiting its application for closed-source models.

data.source: FLORES-200 and Tatoeba parallel sentence datasets.

methodology.calculation: Alignment scores are calculated based on neuron activation states using significant cosine similarity metrics.
methodology.interpretation: Higher alignment scores correlate strongly with better performance on multilingual tasks.
methodology.baseline_results: Pearson correlation of NeuronXA with downstream tasks performance reached 0.9556.
methodology.validation: Evaluated across various multilingual benchmarks and tasks.
